authors.name: Dashkevich Lev Urbanovich
authors.science: Belarusian photographer, publicist, teacher, scientist, inventor
authors.education: He was educated at the University of Dijon and the Graduate School of Graphic Arts in Paris (Department of Photography)

activity.1911: From 1911 he began to publish in scientific journals (La Nature. Paris)
activity.1911-1920: In 1911-1920 he lived in the Caucasus, worked as a teacher of French, physics, natural science and other subjects in the gymnasiums of Eryvani (Yerevan)
activity.1920: At the end of May 1920, he returned to Minsk. Since October 1920, the reader lectures on world literature and photography at the Minsk Institute of National Education
activity.1921: In 1921 he worked in the Scientific Terminology Commission of the People's Commissariat of Education of the BSSR (natural section)
activity.1923: In May-June 1923, he participated in an ethnographic expedition in Igumensk and Borisov Counties
activity.1923-1924: In 1923-1924, a science photographer at the medical faculty of BSU
activity.1930: In 1930 he began working in the Minsk House of Technology, at the geographical faculty of the Belarusian State University
activity.1941-1944: In 1941-1944 he lived in an evacuation in Frunze (now Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan), worked in medical institutions. In September 1944 he returned to Minsk. He worked at the Institute of Theoretical Medicine and the Institute of Physiology

authors.family: In 1908, Lev Dashkevich married Zinaida Knizhnikova. Son Leonard (he was born in 1909)

authors.name: Klinov Artur Aleksandrovich
authors.science: Belarusian artist, designer, photographer, writer, screenwriter, editor-in-chief of the magazine “pARTisan” (2002)
authors.education:
He studied at children's art school number 1 in 1976-1980, and in art studios and workshops of Vladimir Tkachenko, Richard May and Vitaly Charnabrysava in 1978-1982.
In 1982-1987 he studied at the Faculty of Architecture of the Belarusian Polytechnic Institute (with teachers Galina Polyanskaya, Vyacheslav Angelov, Alexander Kollontai, etc.) and received a specialization in urban planning

activity.1986: Since 1986, begins to organize numerous own and joint art exhibitions in Belarus and abroad. In the 1980s, in Minsk, he was an active participant in the non-conformist movement in Belarusian art: in 1987, he founded one of the first informal art groups in the BSSR “Community of Blo” (1987-1990) and was a participant in exhibitions of the band “Forma” (1987- 1990)
activity.1990s: In the 1990s he began to work with objects (he tried to create non-standard clear images) and installations (he used the principles of the philosophy of absurdity and existentialism). He became the author of the projects “Death of the Pioneer” (1995-2000), “Texts” and “50 buckets - masterpieces of world art” (1997-1999), as well as the interactive show “Columbarium of World Literature” (1998)
activity.1998: In 1998, he became the founder and chairman of the Belarusian Association of Contemporary Art and the author of the idea of ​​the “Novinki” International Performance Festival (“NAVINKI”) in Belarus
activity.2002: In 2002, he became the founder and chief editor of the art magazine (almanac of contemporary Belarusian culture) “pARTisan”, where he himself publishes his articles and photographs. He is the chief editor of the Internet portal partisanmag.by
activity.2006: In 2006, he debuted in literature with the Russian-language novel “Minsk. City of the Sun ” (2006), and later published Belarusian-language novels “Shalom” (2010) and “Steklotara” (2013)
activity.February 4, 2008: On February 4, 2008, a presentation of the project “Collection of Partisan”, consisting of a series of albums of Belarusian contemporary art, took place. The first in this series was Arthur Klinov's album "The Twelve". It is a retrospective of the twelve most important projects for an artist over the past 12 years
activity.2009: Since 2009, he began working in film as a screenwriter and artist. He is the art director of the films "Masakra" (2010) and "Hard Reboot" (2014)
activity.2011: In 2011, he represented Belarus at the 54th International Venice Biennale (Italy), where he presented his installation of straw “Dinner”
